entry.title: Group reporting + data collection + SAC - SAP Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We currently have an SAP FC platform serving 15 clients in a SaaS model. Our objective is to migrate this environment to SAP Group Reporting on the public cloud.

All 15 clients will use the Group Reporting solution.

In SAP FC, we are able to separate data for each client by connecting each client to their own SQL database. However, in Group Reporting, there is only one tenant.

Our question is: Is it possible to achieve data separation using authorizations and roles, so that each client can access only their own data and cannot see others‚Äô data?

Our planned setup will include Group Reporting, Data Collection, and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

Thank you very much for your help

entry.title: Solution Order Simulation APIs - OData V4
entry.content:
Table of Contents

  • Table of Contents
  • Introduction
  • Authentication and Access
  • Metadata
  • API Capabilities and Entities
  • BusinessSolutionOrder ‚Äì Solution Order Header
  • BusSolnOrdPartner ‚Äì Solution Order Header Partner
  • BusSolnOrdItmPartner ‚Äì Solution Order Item Partner
  • BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement ‚Äì Item Price Element
  • BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem ‚Äì Item Billing Request Item(Contract Item)

 

Introduction

Solution Order is a business transaction in SAP Cloud ERP, used to sell solutions which can be a combination of either physical goods, one time services, recurring services, subscriptions, or projects bundled as one integrated customer offering. With the 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP,  the OData V4 APIs for simulation of solution order is available. Simulation APIs can be used to simulate various entities of solution order without creating a solution order. Various determination logic like partner determination, price determination, billing plan etc can be simulated without creating a solution order. This can be used to provide a quote using a quoting engine outside of SAP Cloud ERP. Such external quoting solutions can benefit from the possibility of quoting a real time price calculated in SAP Cloud ERP using the Solution Order simulation APIs.  In this blog, you will find more information about the API, the entities available for consumption and the operations on these entities.

 

Authentication and Access

The communication arrangement with the Business Solution Order Integration scenario(SAP_COM_0706) needs
to be in place to access the API. You will need to create a communication arrangement for the communication scenario
SAP_COM_0706, A communication system with an inbound user. You can as well configure OAUTH 2.0 if
needed.

The API supports Basic Authentication(username/password), OAUTH2.0, and X.509 Certificate Authentication

 

Metadata

Metadata provides a description of the service, detailing the structure of the data, available entities, their
properties, relationships, and supported operations. It acts as a blueprint that allows both developers and tools
to understand how to interact with the service without needing prior knowledge of its design.
It can be accessed using the below URL
https://<<SERVER>>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/0001/$metadata
Below is a screenshot, with a part of the metadata of the Business Solution Order API.

In the above partial view of the metadata, you can see the Entity BusinessSolutionOrderItem, it has 2 key fields - BusinessSolutionOrder and BusinessSolutionOrderItem, a set of properties like Product, Quantity, BusSolnOrdItmCategory, etc. it also specifies the type, max length, precision etc of the properties. There are a set of navigational properties(or associations) for the entity. Associations are other entities related to the current entity.

 

API Capabilities and Entities

EntitySupported OperationsDescriptionAssociations
BusinessSolutionOrderCREATE (Simulate)Solution Order Header

_Item

_Partner

BusinessSolutionOrderItemCREATE (Simulate) only using deep insert on BusinessSolutionOrderSolution Order Item

_BusinessSolutionOrder

_Partner

_PriceElement

_BillingRequestItem

BusSolnOrdPartner
CREATE (Simulate) only using deep insert on BusinessSolutionOrderHeader Partner_BusinessSolutionOrder
BusSolnOrdItmPartner
CREATE (Simulate) only using deep insert on BusinessSolutionOrderItem Partner

_BusinessSolutionOrder

_Item

BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement
CREATE (Simulate) only using deep insert on BusinessSolutionOrderItem Price Element

_BusinessSolutionOrder

_Item

BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItemCREATE (Simulate) only using deep insert on BusinessSolutionOrder

Billing Request Line of a Contract Item

_BusinessSolutionOrder

_Item

 

BusinessSolutionOrder ‚Äì Solution Order Header

Simulate solution order with one item to get header and item entities with simulated net value

You can add any number of items to simulate.

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc
{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation Demo",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "PayerParty": "17100001",
  "PaymentTerms": "0001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "_Item": [
    {
      "Product": "TG11",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "PCE"
    }
  ]
}

 

BusSolnOrdPartner ‚Äì Solution Order Header Partner

You can pass an empty _Partner:[] entity in the payload to read the header partners that are determined based on the partner determination procedure assigned to the solution order transaction.

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation Demo",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "PayerParty": "17100001",
  "PaymentTerms": "0001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
 
  //Empty Partner association in payload to return the simulated entity in response
  "_Partner":[],
  
  "_Item": [
    {
      "Product": "TG11",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "PCE"
    }
  ]
}

 

BusSolnOrdItmPartner ‚Äì Solution Order Item Partner

Similar to header partner, You can pass an empty _Partner:[] entity in the payload to read the item partners that are determined based on the partner determination procedure assigned to the item category.

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation Demo",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "PayerParty": "17100001",
  "PaymentTerms": "0001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "_Item": [
    {
      "Product": "TG11",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "PCE",
      
      //Empty Partner association in payload to return the simulated entity in response
      "_Partner": []
    }
  ]
}

You can also override a partner determined in simulation by passing the updated partner in the payload. This can be useful to for example simulate changes in shipping cost based on the address of a new partner that is passed which is different from the determined partner. 

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation Demo",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "PayerParty": "17100001",
  "PaymentTerms": "0001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "_Item": [
    {
      "Product": "TG11",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "ShipToParty": "17100002",
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "PCE",
      
      "_Partner": [
        {
          "CustMgmtPartnerFunction": "00000055",
          "CustMgmtBusinessPartner": "17100002"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

 

BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement ‚Äì Item Price Element

Similar to partners, You can pass an empty _PriceElement[] entity in the payload to read the item price elements that are calculated based on the pricing procedure assigned.

How ever you can also pass a new price element in simulation request like a discount to simulate the solution order with the discount condition

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc
{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation Demo",
  "Language": "EN",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "_Item": [
    {
      "Product": "TG12",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "EA",
      
      //Adding a fixed discount
      "_PriceElement": [
        {
          "ConditionType": "DRV1",
          "ConditionRateValue": -10,
          "ConditionCurrency": "USD"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

 

BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem ‚Äì Item Billing Request Item(Contract Item)

Billing Request Line item is relevant for a service contract item of type SOSC(Service Contract Item) and SOPA(Service Contract Item with Price Adaptation). You can simulate the billing plan by providing the billing date and settlement period in the payload and you will see the Billing Request Items accordingly. For example if you provide a settlement period as monthly for a contract running for 1 year, you will see 12 Billing Request Items in the simulation response.

POST <host> /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_bussolnordsimulation/srvd_a2x/sap/bussolnordersimulation/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Simulation of BRLs",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "_Item": [
    {
      "BusinessSolutionOrderItem": "10",
      "Product": "SRV_CONTRACT",
      "BusSolnOrdItmCategory": "SOSC",
      "Quantity": 1,
      "QuantityUnit": "AU",
      "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "C62",

      // Billing date first of the month
      "SrvcMgmtBillgPlanBillgDateRule": "BILL0002",
      // Settlement period - monthly billing
      "SettlementPeriodRule": "BILL0001",

      "ServiceContrItemStartDateTime": "2025-08-13T00:00:00Z",
      "ServiceContrItemEndDateTime": "2026-08-13T00:00:00Z",
      "_BillingRequestItem": [],
      "_PriceElement": []
    }
  ]
}

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Analytics Cloud - Pre-Built "Project Analytics" Dashboard
entry.content:
Are you aware of the SAP Cloud ALM APIs available for projects that can be used to create custom dashboards? Whether you are seeking a customized view for your daily project analysis or you are here out of curiosity, welcome! There is something in this blog for everyone.

On one hand, we have SAP Cloud ALM, which provides access to project data through APIs, covering areas such as requirements, tasks, defects, .... On the other hand, we have SAP Analytics Cloud, which enables the creation of custom dashboards to visualize and analyze this data. By combining data from SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Analytics Cloud, you can develop dedicated dashboards that offer comprehensive insights into project management activities.

Previously, I showcased pre-built dashboards, "Health Analytics" and "Real User Analytics," utilizing data from SAP Cloud ALM Operations in SAP Analytics Cloud. -> Ready-to-Use Template Dashboards: Integrating SAP ... - SAP Community

This time, I want to show you a new pre-built dashboard "Project Analytics", using the data from Implementation part of SAP Cloud ALM.

 

Can you tell me more about this new pre-built dashboard?

The "Project Analytics" dashboard leverages multiple APIs from SAP Cloud ALM, with each API dedicated to specific project elements, such as requirements, tasks, defects, and more. By creating a separate model for each API, I've integrated these data streams into a cohesive dashboard. This approach allows for a comprehensive view of project implementation, combining diverse data points into informative visualizations tailored to enhance project analysis and decision-making.

This pre-built dashboard shows an example of what you can have in SAP Analytics Cloud by using the APIs of SAP Cloud ALM Implementation. It can be use as it is if it suits your needs. But if you are more interested in specifics elements like "Defects" and not that much into "Tasks", it can be customized to focus on your needs. It can be used as a starting point of discussion. This adaptability ensures that the dashboard meets your unique requirements. 

 

What charts does this pre-built dashboard contain?

The "Project Analytics" dashboard is structured to give both an overview and detailed insights into your project implementation. Here's a breakdown of the dashboard sections:

Project Selection and Date Display:

  • At the top right of the dashboard, you can select from the available projects. In this demo, two project data sets are included. Selecting a project synchronizes all charts to show data specific to that project.
  • To the top right again, the date of the data being viewed is displayed. All models in this dashboard get data automatically from SAP Cloud ALM once daily, each morning, this is the default setup for this dashboard.

Project and Element Overview:

  • The second row provides a summary of the project and its key elements, offering a general view without delving into specifics. This includes the total number of items within the project.

  •  It also presents an overview of the status of features and defects, with multiple iterations of similar charts, because why not?

Detailed Element Analysis:

This section offers a more granular look at certain elements, with a focus on Requirements and Tasks for this demo.

Requirements:

  • You have one chart that illustrate the evolution of items created over time.
  • Some numbers that compare item creation on a weekly and monthly basis, demonstrating possible analytical calculations.
  • A chart which shows the distribution of requirements by status and priority, offering a snapshot of the project's current state.
  • A comparison between confirmed requirements this week and last week provides insight into project progress.

 Tasks:

  • You can see a graph which displays the daily evolution of tasks, broken down by status to observe trends and changes.
  • Then on the right is a table showcasing that beyond numbers, Cloud ALM also provides detailed item information. While this demo includes a few columns, additional details like descriptions and assignees can also be displayed and used on others type of charts.

This pre-built dashboard provide both high-level summaries and detailed analyses. It also showed you some capabilities of integrating data from SAP Cloud ALM projects into SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

How to have it on my SAP Analytics Cloud tenant? 

The installation/customization of the "Project Analytics" dashboard is a service provided by SAP. If you're interested in obtaining this dashboard, whether in its current form or customized to meet your specific needs, please reach out to your SAP representative. 

 

Thank you

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Release 2022 & Higher Release (HCM)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Human Capital Management - Solution Strategy

 

As SAP SuccessFactors remains the primary focus of SAP‚Äôs HCM innovation, there are no plans for major additional functionalities or re-architectures in S/4HANA. HCM in S/4HANA is intended as a bridge to give customers additional time to move to SAP SuccessFactors. Consistency with the Business Suite is ensured by applying the same data model.

Therefore, no new or updated business processes are developed here. Some Fiori apps will be provided over time, including analytical pages ‚Äì check out the Fiori Apps Library and filter for Product Suite SAP S/4HANA and the LoB ‚ÄúHuman Resources‚Äù.

Investments into intelligent scenarios are entirely focused on SuccessFactors, which is one of the frontrunners for Generative AI ‚Äì more details here: Generative AI with SAP

The HCM functionality in S/4HANA is licensed - both in private cloud and on-premise - via engine licenses with an ‚Äúemployee‚Äù metric, no longer by core named user licenses. SAP thus paves the way also commercially for the transition to SuccessFactors, where the same commercial model applies

Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA (H4S4_1)

  • HCM in S/4HANA (Business function H4S4_1) is available in S/4HANA starting from release 2022
  • All HCM customers with S/4HANA Release 2022 or 2023 must activate H4S4_1 business function (docu) in transaction SFW5

‚ÄìA system S/4HANA Release 2022 or 2023  without H4S4_1 business function activation runs as an HCM S/4HANA Compatibility Pack

  • Pay attention: H4S4_1 business function activation is irreversible. It deprecates some HCM (PA, TM & PY) functionalities normally applied in on-premise edition (SAP ERP HCM, HCM S/4HANA Compatibility Pack), so the activation must be object of a Conversion/Upgrade Project to evaluate impact of used deprecated functionalities and implement suggested alternative solutions
    • SAP Note 3091160 - SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì General Approach and Strategy - SAP for Me contains the lists of deprecated functionalities and suggest alternative solutions to apply
    • Readiness Check run gives informations about deprecated functionalities
  • This business function is exclusively available to customers who have purchased a separate license to use SAP Human Capital Management for SAP S/4HANA
  • With the release of S/4HANA 2025 and higher, this business function will be activated by default. Therefore, the new functionality for HCM for S/4HANA is available for all HCM customers.
  • Using the so-called HR mini-master in an SAP S/4HANA system, only to define business partner in the "Employee" role in a non-HCM system, does not require licensing SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA, even if the Business Function H4S4_1 is active. Please refer to SAP Note 3369920.
